channel.title: Protocol, Global PortStart, Global PortEnd, Base HostPort
channel.description:
When i port forward it asks for Protocol, Global PortStart, Global PortEnd, Base HostPort ,
Now for protocol i put in tcp, and for the rest i put in 43594, it let all my friends on, but when i try from my computers, [my laptop] [my desktop] all connected to same internet thru router, it wont let me on, what do i put in for them?

item.title: Protocol, Global PortStart, Global PortEnd, Base HostPort
item.dc:creator: @dragonman2 dragonman2
item.description:
@dragonman2 wrote:

[quote=“nohope, post:1, topic:342747”][quote author=geterperez link=topic=328727.msg2571204#msg2571204 date=1228678210]
When i port forward it asks for Protocol, Global PortStart, Global PortEnd, Base HostPort ,

Now for protocol i put in tcp, and for the rest i put in 43594, it let all my friends on, but when i try from my computers, [my laptop] [my desktop] all connected to same internet thru router, it wont let me on, what do i put in for them?
[/quote]
Put the ip as 127.0.0.1 and the port as 43594.[/quote]

Yeah that should fix it. The only time when u use the ip is in hamachi servers…

Read full topic
item.source: Protocol, Global PortStart, Global PortEnd, Base HostPort

item.title: Protocol, Global PortStart, Global PortEnd, Base HostPort
item.dc:creator: @Ahyo Ahyo
item.description:
@Ahyo wrote:

im trying to portfoward on a westell router also, i did exactly what u did, but it didnt even let me host on mopar…i have no idea why, but when i post online it says “server offline” and im like wtf i just got finished portfowarding…Tell me exactly what u did, if u dont mind me asking ?

Read full topic
